question: Main and nose wheel bays are:

choices.choice: pressurised.
unpressurised.
conditioned.
different, with the mains being unpressurised and the nose pressurised.

subject: Technical

question: Normal maximum negative differential pressure is:

choices.choice: when atmospheric pressure exceeds cabin pressure by the amount permitted by the system controls.
where the cabin pressure falls below aircraft altitude pressure at which time the inward relief valve opens.
when the cabin pressure exceeds the atmospheric pressure by 0.5 PSI.
the pressure at which the duct relief valve is set to operate.

subject: Technical

question: When would the negative differential limit be reached/exceeded:

choices.choice: rapid descent when AC descends below cabin altitude.
during ground pressure testing.
rapid ascent when aircraft climbs.
when changing to manual operation.

subject: Technical

question: A/C in level flight if cabin altitude increases does pressure diff:

choices.choice: increase.
decrease.
remain the same.
nil.

subject: Technical

question: In level pressurised flight does the outflow valve:

choices.choice: close.
adjust to provide constant flow, and is normally partially open.
open to increase air conditioning.
adjust to provide constant flow, and is normally almost closed.

subject: Technical

question: In a turbo cooler system is the cooling air:

choices.choice: ram air.
engine by pass air.
cabin air.
compressor air.

subject: Technical

question: The rate of change of cabin pressure should be kept to the minimum. Is this more important:

choices.choice: in descent.
in climb.
in periods when the dehumidifier is in use.
in cruise.

subject: Technical

question: Is a cabin humidifier:

choices.choice: on the ground in conditions of low relative humidity.
at high altitude.
at low altitude.
on the ground in high ambient temperatures.

subject: Technical

question: Fatigue life of the fuselage is based on the:

choices.choice: number of pressurisation cycles.
number of explosive decompressions.
number of landings only.
number of cycles at maximum differential.

subject: Technical

question: If the forward oil seal in an axial flow compressor fails, will air be:

choices.choice: contaminated.
unaffected.
‘b’ is only correct if synthetic oil is used.
‘a’ will be correct only if the aircraft is inverted.

subject: Technical

question: Rate of change of cabin altitude is shown on a:

choices.choice: special gauge.
aircraft VSI.
cabin pressure controller.
gauge reading a percentage of Max Diff Pressure.

subject: Technical

question: Cabin discharge valve (pneumatic. is supplied with:

choices.choice: air data computer output information.
cabin and static pressure.
cabin pressure, static and air speed information.
cabin pressure only.

subject: Technical

question: On what principle does the vapour cycle cooling system work on:

choices.choice: liquid into vapour.
vapour into liquid.
vapour into gas.
cold gas into hot gas.

subject: Technical

question: What is the purpose of the duct relief valve:

choices.choice: to protect the undercarriage bay.
to ensure the compressor pressure is regulated.
to prevent damage to the ducts.
to relieve excess pressure to compressor return line.

subject: Technical

question: What system is installed to control the air conditioning:

choices.choice: emulsifier and water extractor.
impingement type dehydrator and humidifier.
dehydrator only.
humidifier only.

subject: Technical

question: How is the (charge) air cooled in a bootstrap (turbo-compressor) system?

choices.choice: by expanding over turbine.
by expanding over turbine driving compressor.
via an air cooled radiator.
by passing it through the fuel heater.

subject: Technical

question: At the max differential phase, is the discharge valve:

choices.choice: open.
closed.
under the control of the rate capsule.
partly open.

subject: Technical

question: What is the purpose of inward relief valves:

choices.choice: to prevent negative differential.
to back up the duct relief valve.
to allow positive pressure to be bled off in an emergency.
to back up the outflow valve.

subject: Technical

question: On a ground pressurisation test, if the cabin suffers a rapid de-pressurisation:

choices.choice: the temperature will rise suddenly.
water precipitation will occur.
damage to hull may occur.
duct relief valve may jam open

subject: Technical

question: A heat exchanger functions by:

choices.choice: combining ram and charge air.
mixing the various vapours inside the heat exchanger.
passing charge air through ducts and cool air around ducts.
removing the static charge.

subject: Technical

question: Maximum Differential pressure:

choices.choice: is the maximum authorised pressure difference between the inside of the fuselage and the atmospheric ambient pressure.
is the absolute pressure provided by the vacuum pump.
is the pressure loss over a given time limit.
is the absolute pressure the cabin pressure ducting is designed to carry.

subject: Technical

question: A humidifier is fitted to:

choices.choice: extract the moisture content in the air.
filter the air.
increase the moisture content in the air when operating at high altitude.
to ensure the cabin air is saturated at high altitude.

subject: Technical

question: If the discharge or outflow valve closes:

choices.choice: the duct relief valve will take control.
the inward relief valve would assume control.
the safety valve would limit the positive pressure difference.
the safety relief valve would limit the negative pressure difference.

subject: Technical

question: Air for conditioning and pressurisation is taken from:

choices.choice: the engine compressor or cabin compressor.
the engine by pass duct or thrust reverse by pass duct.
the engine compressor or ram turbine.
the engine turbine or cabin compressor.

subject: Technical

question: Safety valves are biased:

choices.choice: inwards.
outwards.
in the direction sensed by the SVC.
neither a nor b.

subject: Technical

question: Cabin compressors:

choices.choice: increase their flow in cruise conditions.
decrease their flow in cruise conditions.
increase their flow in proportion to increases of altitude differential pressure and reduction in engine RPM in order to maintain the mass flow.
deliver minimum air at sea level via the cold air unit.

subject: Technical

question: In a pressurisation circuit the sequence of operation is for the:

choices.choice: inward relief valve to open before the safety valve.
outflow valve to operate before the safety valve.
outflow valve to operate after the safety valve.
outflow valve to operate the same time as the safety valve.

subject: Technical

question: With the QFE set on the cabin controller, against an altitude of zero:

choices.choice: the fuselage will be pressurised on landing.
a ground pressurisation will automatically take place.
the cabin will be unpressurised on landing.
the flight deck will be depressurised.

subject: Technical

question: In the cruise at 30,000 ft the cabin altitude is adjusted from 4,000 ft to 6,000 ft:

choices.choice: cabin differential will increase.
cabin differential will not be affected.
cabin differential will decrease.
nil.

subject: Technical

question: An aircraft climbs from sea level to 16,000 ft at 1,000 ft per min, the cabin pressurisation is set to climb at 500 ft per min to a cabin altitude of 8,000 ft. The time taken for the cabin to reach 8,000 ft is:

choices.choice: the same time as it takes the aircraft to reach 16,000 ft.
half the time it takes the aircraft to reach 16,000 ft.
twice the time it takes the aircraft to reach 16,000 ft.
three times the time it takes the aircraft to reach 16,000 ft.

subject: Technical

question: The aircraft inhibiting switch connected to the A/C landing gear:

choices.choice: allows the aircraft to be pressurised on the ground.
stops pressurising on the ground and ensures that there is no pressure differential.
ensures that the discharge valve is closed.
cancels out the safety valve on the ground.

subject: Technical

question: Negative differential is limited by:

choices.choice: dump valve.
inward relief valve.
outflow valve.
safety valve.

subject: Technical

question: Sequence of air through a vapour cooling system is:

choices.choice: turbine then expansion valve.
tank then evaporator.
turbine then evaporator.
compressor then turbine.

subject: Technical

question: To maintain a steady and constant airflow regardless of altitude or cabin pressure:

choices.choice: a duct relief valve is fitted.
a venturi device is fitted.
a mass flow controller is fitted.
a thermostatic relief valve is fitted.

subject: Technical

question: The term “pressurisation cycle” means:

choices.choice: air introduced into a fuselage under pressure only.
air introduced into a fuselage under pressure until the time the air is released.
air discharged from the fuselage, above 15 psi.
the frequency in Hz the pressure cycles from the rootes blowers enter the fuselage.

subject: Technical

question: Inward Relief Valves operate:

choices.choice: in conjunction with the cabin pressure controller when there is a negative diff.
in conjunction with the cabin altitude selector when there is negative diff.
when manually selected during the emergency descent procedure.
automatically when there is a negative diff.

subject: Technical

question: Safety valves operate:

choices.choice: at higher than maximum differential
as soon as initiation takes place.
at a lower diff than a discharge valve.
at a set value, which is selected.

subject: Technical

question: Ditching Cocks are operated:

choices.choice: automatically when the soluble plugs disolve.
to shut all outflow valves.
to direct pressure into flotation bags.
for rapid depressurisation.

subject: Technical

question: Duct Relief Valves operate when:

choices.choice: excessive pressure builds up in the air conditioning system supply ducts.
to keep cabin pressure close to ambient pressure.
to prevent the floor from collapsing should baggage door open.
the cooling modulator shutters reach the optimised position.

subject: Technical

question: During a normal pressurised cruise, the discharge valve position is:

choices.choice: at a position pre-set before take off.
partially open.
open until selected altitude is reached.
closed until selected altitude is reached.

subject: Technical

question: A dump valve:

choices.choice: automatically opens when fuel is dumped.
is controlled manually.
is opened automatically when the safety valve opens.
is controlled by the safety valve integrating line.

subject: Technical

question: If pressure is manually controlled:

choices.choice: an extra member is required to monitor system operation.
the climb rate would be maintained automatically.
climb rate could not be maintained.
care should be taken to ensure climb/descent rates are safe.

subject: Technical

question: An aircraft is prevented from pressurising on the ground by:

choices.choice: the auto deflating valve on the main oleos.
inhibiting micro switches on the landing gear.
inhibiting micro switches on the throttles.
the pressure control master switch.

subject: Technical

question: If the pressurisation air is passed over the cold air unit compressor does it:

choices.choice: increase the charge air temperature.
decrease the charge air temperature.
decrease the charge air pressure.
make no change to the charge air condition.

subject: Technical

question: If the cabin pressure increases in level flight does the cabin VSI show:

choices.choice: rate of climb.
no change unless the aircraft climbs.
rate of descent.
nil.

subject: Technical

question: Cabin altitude in pressured flight is:

choices.choice: the altitude corresponding to cabin pressure regardless of aircraft height.
is presented on a second needle on the aircraft altimeter.
altitude at which cabin pressure equals ambient pressure.
altitude corresponding to cabin pressure in relation to MSL ISA conditions.

subject: Technical

question: The term pressure cabin is used to describe:

choices.choice: pressurisation of the flight deck only.
the ability to pressurise the aircraft to a higher than ambient pressure.
the passenger cabin on an airliner.
the ability to maintain a constant pressure differential at all altitudes.

subject: Technical

question: A pressurisation system works by:

choices.choice: essentially constant input mass flow and variable output.
essentially constant output mas flow and variable input.
does not start until an altitude of 8,000 ft has been reached.
supplying hot gases from the engine exhaust unit to the mass flow control system.

subject: Technical

question: When air is pressurised by an engine driven compressor, it is also:

choices.choice: moisturised.
heated.
cooled.
the temperature is not affected.

subject: Technical
